ACT
88
Deprivation of a necessary part in favor of descendants
If a descendant who is entitled to a necessary share is over-indebted or spendthrift, the testator can expressly deprive him of his necessary share in whole or in part in his will for the benefit of his descendants.
This deprivation remains valid only if, at the time of opening the inheritance, the deprived person has a minor child or a minor grandchild from a predeceased child, or has an adult child or an adult grandchild from a predeceased child who are unable to work and do not have the necessary means of subsistence.
The deprived heir inherits the decedent in the part that is not covered by the deprivation.
A dispossessed heir inherits the decedent even when the prerequisites for dispossession no longer exist at the time of the decedent's death.
